item.title: Senior Manager, Marketing Science Test and Learn
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Marketing Science Test and Learn

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Drive and execute a rapid in-market ‘Test and Learn’ platform to acquire, grow, and retain our clients using all available data sources including but not limited to RBC’s data warehouse, proprietary research studies and third party external data sources
  • Working with product partners and other marketing science teams in the ‘Test and Learn’ environment to deliver, evaluate, and improve daily targeting in order to identify the right product, offer, and channel for our clients in near-real time
  • Recommend strategies leveraging an analytical approach to deliver objectives and achieve results across acquisition, growth and retention KPIs
  • Transform and optimize marketing process and spend to shape the future of RBC marketing capabilities
  • Develop dashboards and provide transparency of results (e.g., daily monitoring) and communicate effectively to all levels and partners
  • Execute deep dive analytics for areas within the dashboard or daily results relative to plan, forecast or targets to support the delivery of client insights.
  • Support the “story-telling” to ensure insights are delivered in a meaningful and relevant manner to business partners
  • Foster strong working relationships with business partners, Digital Marketing, Data Management Office, Enterprise Information Management (EIM) and other CRM & Analytics  teams to build the learning agenda for the Next Best Offer capability

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Proven experience in analytical database marketing, business analytics, big data or related marketing analytics role
  • Superior and proven experience in the application of experimental design and statistical analysis of results coupled with strong understanding of technical skills in SAS, SQL, Hadoop, or Teradata. 
  • Excellent analytical skills - ability to creatively problem solve real world business problems and communicate complex analytical solutions in user friendly language.
  • Bias for action leading design against tight timelines and in a fast-paced, dynamic and changing environment
  • Excellent interpersonal and interaction skills to include communications, presentation and conflict resolution skills
  • Demonstrated/proven ability to drive change and continuously reinvent

Nice-to-have

  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of marketing, product management, sales, finance, pricing and risk management is preferred
  • Master’s degree in quantitative discipline

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, and stock where applicable
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Summary

Do you classify yourself as a subject matter expert in the areas of business analytics, consumer behavior, direct marketing, and machine-learning data tools? Do you possess strong business acumen and a proven track record of execution in a dynamic environment? If so we want to hear from you.

RBC is recruiting for a Senior Manager of Marketing Science Test and Learn. In this exciting role you will be responsible for the application of advanced analytics using “big data” to drive in-market test and learn strategies as part of RBC’s new “Next Best Offer” capability: targeted, optimized offers to acquire, grow, and retain our clients.

Working with our Canadian Banking and Insurance Partners, as well as key third parties, you will leverage powerful machine learning techniques and predictive models from within the Marketing Science department and run a dynamic test and learn environment – with the ultimate goal of realizing incremental revenue growth across all client segments and products.

item.title: Senior Data Analyst (IAM) (GCS)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Data Analyst (IAM) (GCS)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As part of RBC’s digital transformation the Identity & Access Management (IAM) team is building out a data analytics & identity governance pillar with the mandate to consolidate, cleanse, govern, and enrich our IAM data to make strong data driven strategic decisions.  The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible to build and maintain the analytics model using RBC’s analytics tools, support the ongoing evolution of the IAM Data Analytics function, including finding new and innovative insights from existing or potential data sources, and identification of new opportunities to strengthen governance processes and reduce risk.

What will you do?

  • Develop and lead the requirements gathering, documentation, data capture, and analysis processes in partnership with stakeholders
  • Leverage visualization dashboard to present data-driven insights and actionable recommendations, ensuring that the information is easily understood and interpreted.
  • Conduct exploratory analysis and interpretation of new and different data sources to identify valuable and innovative insights.
  • Work with teams across IAM and the enterprise, to find new opportunities to strengthen reporting and challenge existing analytics & governance models
  • Provide guidance, feedback, coaching, and mentoring to build the capabilities of other Data Analyst(s) on the team

What do you need to succeed?

  • 4+ years of experience performing common extract, transform, load (ETL) operations on structured datasets
  • 1-2 years of experience with data visualization/business insights tools, such as Tableau
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL
  • Experience with requirements gathering and documentation
  • Experience with programming and scripting languages (eg. Python, SQL)
  • Understanding of data management practices and data pipelines
  • Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal)
  • Strong critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills

Nice-to-have

  • Familiarity with the IAM domain and data
  • Experience in team Leadership and mentoring
  • Strong Excel and powerpoint skills
  • Experience working with big data tools/solutions

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Data Analyst, Advice Centre Data Enablement & Analytic Research
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analyst, Advice Centre Data Enablement & Analytic Research

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing team of data engineers, scientists, developers and analysts. You will play a pivotal role in analyzing and detecting trends, reducing regulatory risk and providing insights to partners in Regulatory Compliance and Client Care. You will be responsible for collaborating with product leads, data analysts and data scientists to design, launch and iterate on user-centric data insights use cases.

What will you do?

  • Design solutions which deliver data based insights to relevant stakeholders, simplify user experience and address user pain points
  • Develop analytics strategies and frameworks to monitor trends and risk markers using statistics, metrics and models
  • Regularly conduct analytics to identify patterns, trends and hidden causation and correlation relationships with complaints data
  • Collaborate with data engineers to source and understand complaints data
  • Work with regulatory and level 2 complaint handling teams to test and improve solutions as well as support investigation of complaints patterns
  • Deliver reporting and analytics on complaints and other regulatory metrics to track the success of the complaints monitoring framework.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 2+ years’ experience in data analytics, SQL, data visualization (Tableau or similar), and Python
  • First-hand experience working with popular Python libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and notebook environments
  • Qualitative and quantitative experience, and solid experience with understanding users and informing those stories with data
  • Strong understanding of data and statistics
  • Experience with databases and data structures
  • Professional oral and written communication skills, with the ability to collaborate between technical and non-technical stakeholders

Nice to have:

  • Undergraduate degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering or related field
  • Knowledge or experience with detecting external or internal fraud
  • Knowledge of  Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, HDFS, Hive)
  • Experience working on an Agile team

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • An opportunity to further develop people management skills
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Career progression if you have what it takes to be the best

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Job Title

Director, Enterprise Data Tooling and Integration

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Setup agile delivery teams and lead all aspects of the design, development, and production support of the enterprise data management and governance platform
  • Define and deliver the overall solution and integration architecture to ensure consistency across the enterprise and alignment to cloud, security, enterprise data, and LOB architecture
  • Provide technical leadership, expert counsel, and guidance to the development team, adhering to solution architecture and best practices along with hands-on contribution
  • Actively pursue innovative solutions and capabilities and present opportunities to senior leadership (platform extension, automation, simplification, integration). In addition, identify opportunities to iteratively improve our technology paying down technical debt as a habit
  • Leads and advocates for client-centric solutions and enhanced user experience and interface
  • Ensures that code, assets, and documentation are up to date and adhere to coding standards and technical design principles

What do you need to succeed?

Must Haves:

  • Exceptional knowledge of IT systems and software development
  • Extensive experience in building Applications using Java-Spring Boot or Node.js, Angular, HTML, SQL, JavaScript, Mule soft,  Kubernetes, Groovy , RESTful APIs, Authentication, SSL, SSO, Apigee.
  • Experience working with Collibra DGC/DIC, BPMN workflows, AnyPoint Studio, Linux and Windows platform etc.
  • Experience working with and setting up modern software development best practices (source control, automated testing, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, declarative infrastructure, etc.).
  • Strong collaboration,  partnership and relationship management skills with the ability to manage ambiguity to drive impactful outcomes
  • Work strategically, stretching beyond traditional information management practices, leveraging industry leading and innovative approaches to solving data challenges 
  • Strong communication, leadership, and influence skills
  • Data analytics and reporting skills

In this role Director Enterprise Data Tooling and Integration you will work with business, and IT stakeholders to drive the design, development, integration and support of the Enterprise Data Governance and Management platform. You will provide subject matter expertise, innovative solutions, and support to help users adopt the platform while adhering to best practices. In addition, you will work with stakeholders and industry experts to identify and implement capabilities required for successful tooling adoption, extension and user experience. item.title: Manager, Measurement & Performance
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Measurement & Performance

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Investor & Treasury Services Malaysia is a processing center of operational excellence supporting 10 countries across three geographic time zones. The country employs a global operating model to maximise efficiencies across time zones and supports a 24/5 operations.

In this role, you will report to the Director, Measurement & Performance, Client Operations, and be responsible for monthly data collection and analysis for management and client KPI reporting deliverables. You will be working with all Client Operations business lines and support client managers on Client KPI related inquiries and requests. In addition, you will work with team members and data experts on initiatives to improve data management, automation and visualization.

Working hours: 9:00AM – 6:00PM (flexibility required due to time zone difference with Europe and Canada)

Region:  Malaysia

What will you do?

  • Be a local lead responsible for monthly global business reporting cycle including data collection, data validation, report production and review.

  • Work closely with respective Global Client Operations business lines, ensure data and information received and obtained from business SME, business applications are complete, accurate and delivered on time.

  • Meet with global client managers to discuss new client reporting requirements and change requirements.

  • Gain a thorough understanding of metric production and ownership across all locations and work with the Measurement and Performance team to centralize and standardize the reporting to ensure global consistency and best practice management.

  • Work closely with other business teams on the data collection, analysis and preparation of various ad hoc requests for management insights.

  • Actively collaborate with IT development teams and operational teams to automate data collection processes and management.

  • Develop and review management systems (EUC) in collaboration with stakeholders.

  • Assist in formalizing operational procedures and documents tasks.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Undergraduate Business, Finance, or Statistics degree with 3+ years’ experience in financial services, preferably in Transfer Agency or Asset Management Services industry.

  • Analytical thinking, problem solving skills, curiosity and critical thinking when analyzing big data.

  • Advanced MS Excel (comprehensive formulas, pivot table, VBA Macro) and PowerPoint presentation skills.

  • Data mining and reporting skill, with ability to explore new technologies to enhance the delivery of operating.

  • Outstanding business and financial acumen with strong analytical, coordination, communication and presentation skills.

Nice-to-have

  • Strong knowledge of banking products, processes and systems (Fund Accounting, Custody, Shareholder Services, OTC).

  • Project Management skill.

  • May need to supervise/coordinate more junior resource activities and share experience.

  • Experience with Client Experience and/or data automation would be considered an asset.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including performance based bonuses, flexible benefits, and competitive compensation.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.

  • A world-class training program in financial services.

  • A collaborative dynamic culture where personal initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded.

Job Summary

In this role, you will be responsible for monthly data collection and analysis for management and client KPI reporting deliverables. You will be working with all Client Operations business lines and support client managers on Client KPI related inquiries and requests. In addition, you will work with team members and data experts on initiatives to improve data management, automation and visualization.

Address:

item.title: Senior Manager, Cards Portfolio Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Cards Portfolio Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will have broad ownership over RBC’s network strategy and will support in ongoing ideation, business case development, and execution of pricing optimization initiatives. You will be accountable to influence senior stakeholders and collaborate with numerous partner organizations to deliver growth using data driven analysis.

What will you do?

  • Manage multi-million network incentive funds and collaborate closely with Marketing, Product Owners, and Finance to maximize ROI and ensure adherence to both internal processes and external obligations
  • Analyze network data, merchant volumes, and interchange rates to forecast key revenue and cost drivers for internal and external stakeholders
  • Act as the subject matter expert of network contracts. Advise senior leaders on strategic contractual levers and provide consulting to business partners on all matters related to network contract
  • Build a strong understanding of credit card pricing policies (e.g. risk based pricing, authorization strategy) and identify areas for RBC to optimize policy to drive bottom line growth
  • Support in business case development for pricing optimization through both quantitative analysis and qualitative assessment
  • Partner with functional SMEs across different areas to execute policy optimization
  • Participate in ad-hoc analytical exercise, using internal and macro-economic data, and dive deep into Cards’ trends / identify emerging risks. Share insight with senior management in executive updates and earnings call preparation
  • Mentor other members of the team on driving insights and recommendation using analysis grounded in data

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Sciences, Math, Engineering
  • 4+ years of experience in analytical role, with preference in financial services or consulting industry
  • Ability to collaborate and influence a broad range of stakeholders from diverse backgrounds
  • Strong prioritization and adaptability skills
  • Willingness to mentor other members
  • Proficient in Teradata SQL, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Manages the development, implementation and support of business analytics initiatives and projects. Typically manages 2 or more specialized departments comprised of supervisors, managers, professionals, and/or large numbers of operational support employees.
